Class IsLoggedInMiddleware

java.lang.Object
com.feis.eduhub.backend.common.middlewares.IsLoggedInMiddleware
public class IsLoggedInMiddleware extends Object
Middleware class for handling user authentication state checks. This class provides functionality to verify if a user is logged in by validating a JWT (JSON Web Token) stored in request's cookies. In order for this o work, the class uses the JwtService class for token management and validation operations.
See Also:
  • JwtService
  • JsonWebToken
  • Handler
  • TokenValidationException
  • AlreadyAuthenticatedException

  • Method Details

    • isLoggedIn

      public static io.javalin.http.Handler isLoggedIn(boolean strict, boolean sendResponseOnValidToken, boolean setAccountId, boolean setJwt)
      Middleware handler for user authentication state check. If the JWT is invalid, then the token gets removed from the user cookies and persistence storage as well.
      Parameters:
      strict - If true, throws TokenValidationException when no token is present in the header as a cookie named sessionId. If false, allows requests without tokens to pass through.
      sendResponseOnValidToken - If true, throws AlreadyAuthenticatedException when a valid token is present. Useful for endpoints that should only be accessed by non-authenticated users.
      setAccountId - If true adds a accountId context attribute which can be used by next handlers as a reference of which account is making the request
      setJwt - If true adds a jwtData context Object attribute which represents the auth token that is getting used to authenticate the account
      Returns:
      A Handler (used as a middleware) that processes the authentication verification logic.
      Throws:
      io.javalin.http.UnauthorizedResponse - If the token is missing (when strict is true) or invalid.
      AlreadyAuthenticatedException - If sendResponseOnValidToken is true and a valid token is present.
      See Also:
      • Handler
